page.title: 06CRABBS GREEN ARABLE FARM
page.content:
{FARMING, GRT CANFIELD}
{Crabbs Green}is a small owner occupied arable farm of l32 acres. The present timber framed house was built about l580, and altered at various times since. The name possibly comes from one of the early owners John Crabb. The present owner occupiers are 3rd generation. The grandparents moved in in l889, and started a retail{milk {round}in Hatfield Broad Oak in l90l. The milk was then produced from a herd of cows kept at the farm. Since l953 milk has been bought in from a wholesale dairy. There is now 1 farm worker and 1 milk roundswoman and the owners. There are two old timber framed barns, a new implement shed and grain silo and a few smaller brick built sheds.
